column5: my condolences.  Great pics of the pup.
sorry to hear ... i truly feel for ya ... That day will come for us too .... just don't want to think about it. They add so much joy to the family.
Sorry about this news---it's a tough thing  They are a member of the family for sure
so sorry to hear, looks like she lived a great life and was enjoyed by all though..
Aw..  what a sweetheart.  That's a tough loss to bare.  Stay strong.  You're doing the right thing.  cheers HD
They add so much joy to the family.  That right there sums up a dog.

Sorry to hear you and the family are going through some sad days. She looks so much like one of the huskies I had. Ours made it to 16, same leg problems, but wandered off when it was her time. Sounds like you have some amazing memories though!

Man it brought me to tears reading this thread, I have had to put down a couple of my pups over the years, and its the hardest thing I've had to do. When we knew it was time for our 12year old lab to go down I was able to find a vet here in Peterborough who would come to the house to do it. I layed a blanket out in the back yard sun was shining  I got him to lay down on his favorite blanket and laid beside him and looked into his eyes until he was gone, I didn't want him to go in a strange environment but at home with us, and then as a last sign of respect I carried his body to the vets vehicle. It was tough on us but I thought it was only fair as he was my loyal friend, sure it cost a little more but was worth it to me. Resting your head on the pillow at night, know you loved her as much as possible and think about the great life you gave her. I feel for you !
There's a lot of good memories there with your pal. Sorry for your loss.

Never followed through today. She had a real goodnight indoors. One more appointment for her tomorrow just to get a second opinion. Kids are devastated at the though, so we might keep her around a few more weeks if the vet says that wouldbe okay
So sorry to hear, always very tough to say goodbye to your best friend.
Oh man, so sorry to see this. I know I have to do the same soon and this is making me 'well up'. Enjoy every memory you have of her and make more good ones while you can.
Sorry to hear this man! It sucks. Hardest thing ive ever had to do. Keep your chin up. You'l" get thru this, and the pooch will always be remembered.  S.
I feel sorry for you.  It's a tough thing to do.  I've had to  put down 4 pets over the years but I didn't want to see them suffer.  You'll have lots of fond memories of your dog.

We have a member on this board that posts as Lake Ranger and she's an amazing artist that specializes in animals. I had her do a 19 x 24 pastel picture of my dog a couple years ago and couldn't believe how nice it turned out.  I haven't seen her post here in a long time and don't even know if she's still around or can be contacted, but just thought some of you dog lovers may be interested.  Just another nice way to remember your friend.
Really nice picture Lew.So real looking.She did a great job.
Thanks Dave, well worth the money.

We have a member on this board that posts as Lake Ranger and she's an amazing artist that specializes in animals. I had her do a 19 x 24 pastel picture of my dog a couple years ago and couldn't believe how nice it turned out.  I haven't seen her post here in a long time and don't even know if she's still around or can be contacted, but just thought some of you dog lovers may be interested.  Just another nice way to remember your friend.    When I seen Lews,I had one done as well before our Tink left us. Done by the same artist. And yes,worth every cent.
When I seen Lews,I had one done as well before our Tink left us. Done by the same artist. And yes,worth every cent.   Well done as well Brian.
I remember that as well Brian, really nice !!

After 14 strong years, she is getting put down. She fought hard this winter and i was so proud of her, but age has just taken its toll on her old legs:( not looking forward to this one bit. She's an amazing pup, and such a huge part of the family. Ughh, just had to vent a lil
Sorry to hear.  I take that it was great with kids?
Sorry to hear Manitou- that's always tough.
14 is a good age but still tough
You have my sympathies Manitou, I went through the same sad thing 2 weeks ago and it's very tough.

But she has gotten nippy in her age too, she has her moments. But last few weeks her legs are just giving out on her. So painful to watch. Amazing companion out in the wild too. She sure loves to gish
Very sorry to hear this
Sorry bud.

It is hurtful to have to do, but better than letting your friend suffer. My Lucky was 17 when we decided to put her down. She was a wonderful friend, but her health was failing and she was suffering. I still think about her and our other dogs often. Better to think of the wonderful 14 years you had together. You have my heartfelt sympathies.
ahh she is beautiful..So sorry you have to go thru this.I have had to put 2 dogs down over the years and its never easy..Give her lots of hugs and remember the great times..
So sorry to hear this , very sad thing to do .

I have 2 pups of my own, 6 year old Beagle/Collie and a 4 year old Cockapoo. They are a huge part of our family. Brings a tear to my eye just imagining what you are going through. Stay strong, deepest sympathies from my family to yours.
. Cooking her favorite meal, set up a bed in the kiddos room. Let her enjoy her life and feel that love.
Ah dood…….so sorry to hear….its really tough. Those pictures made me tear up.
Tough one bud. Keep your head up. Take joy in the memories and how happy your dogs life was because of you.

A lot of tears. Kids are tucked in with her. I just feel horrible. We took a few pics just for memory sake, but man this sucks. I just feel so sad, so guilty. Took me an hour to snap a pic without crying thanks you guys for understanding. Means the world to us.
Wow, sorry to hear that.  Such a hard thing to do!
I dont wanna post these pics to bum anyone out. I'm just doing it to be sentimental in my own way

You post as many pictures as you want!  I have been through it more times than I care to remember, just try to remember that while this is very hard on you it is the kindest thing you can do for your beloved friend!  My heart goes out to you!
It hurts no dought about it.  Sorry.

last month my jack russel 14 years of WELL should I say entertainment.. he,s resting in my backyard. the city says you cant intern them on your property. oh well. . like cliff said I also have gone down the road to say farewell to quite a few furry friends. its a bummer.
